Outdated ideas, truths, and morals literally have to die with their hosts, leaving way for a new generation to swing the pendulum back when it's their turn, and this can be maddeningly slow when it comes to our most obvious, urgent, and progressive ideas. Just look at how we are experiencing the ugly, cruel, and inhumane legacy of 400 years of slavery, bigotry, and systemic racism - even now, even still now, a century and a half since we fought the most costly and all-important civil war. Not since our war of independence have we had such an outright challenge to the democratic way of life, so closely linked and akin with what our two-party political system and former leader, a certifiable and self-serving megalomaniac in the time-honored Office of the Presidency, directing actions, which we now have proof in hand, that were intended as nothing short of a coup. But I digress... forgive me if the last four years and COVID have taken their toll on me.I ask you in all sincerity, where would mankind, medicine, industry, technology, and science be if not for those who rail against the system, asking the impertinent questions and demanding timely answers, answers that come with verifiable evidence, and satisfy the query? Much has been done, to be sure, but much more needs doing if we are to consider ourselves leaders amongst the worlds most powerful countries. If we are to grow beyond the limits of our imagination we must dare to do the unimaginable. We must not be afraid to ask why. Children aren't. Children in their first years are learning at an unprecedented rate, one we will never know again, and the whys come just as natural to them as breathing. So Why as adults have we stopped asking why, and why have we learned to accept no response to our questions? Or worse still, recycled rhetoric. It is precisely this attitude, and No Other, that will allow us to cure hunger, poverty, pollution, gain the upper hand in medicine and therapies, cure disease, conquer dementia, and yes, even tackle and reverse climate change. Because if we don't ask the questions, we'll get no answers, and That, my friends, That is the end of Everything!So in the tradition of every explorer, every inventor, professor, conquering king, pioneer, and spiritual guide, I give this film, a film which dares to push beyond the known limits into uncharted territory, I give it a 10. A 10 with a smile on my face, a spark of hope in my eyes, and a Great Big Thank You!

I don't know if it was the direction or the fact that everyone was an executive director placing too many cooks in the kitchen. It could have been so much more because the story was actually a pretty cool concept. Its problem was that it was poorly told. It was slow to evolve, and it caused my mind to wonder into the various ways it could go. Instead of making us wait until the last couple of episodes to inform us of the direction it was taking, it should have done so at the beginning. I am quite certain that many people found it boring and dropped out after the third or fourth episode. The only reason I stayed with it was because I had nothing better to do, and the acting was actually quite good. I rate the skills of the acting at 9 out of ten stars and the story an eight. The way the story was presented though is only worth a one. If that. So, eighteen divided by three gives a total of six stars.

reviews.review_title: Underwhelming - book plot is way better
reviews.content: Disappointing - no climax, no anguish, no story...the acting was good but felt like a waste of time. If you go to the trivia section on this page to the bottom it tells you how the book was and THAT is how unsettling it should have been!
I do not even want to waste more time to write a review on this show. Just please Do not watch it. I starte watching bc of Nicole but got disappointed ver soon.

reviews.review_title: My god this show is so slow and rubbish...
reviews.content: Nothing happens, I mean absolutely nothing, it's one of the most boring programs I have ever watched. Such a waste of quite a good cast, not entirely sure how they agreed to such a weak script.

Nicole Kidman with a ruskie accent?It's whacky, uneventful, very unsettling, undefined plot.Don't get me wrong, the cast is lovely but 8 episodes and then what?I could've gone shopping had a hair cut, done a meal prep and more. Lol
Really don't comprehend where it was all leading to, hopefully there won't be a sequel.

reviews.review_title: To watch because of actors and original script
reviews.content: Nicole Kidman is great in this very difficult part. She could have acted very bad but instead the level of carachterization is so high that even the few uneven moment are forgotten easily. I underline that her part is extremely difficult. In general all actors are very good. I love Melissa McCarthy, Bobby Cannavale, Like Ewans, Manny Jacinto and Grace Van Patten.The script is something unusual and could be really opinioned, so I think you must judge by yourself.

I gotta be honest and say I have no clue how this show is gonna turn out, but I'm enjoying every second of it.Nine Perfect Strangers is a masterful tale of lives. Each patient comes clinic with a unique problem and perspective on the world. As the show progresses, you are given a glimpse into each characters dirty laundry and the vices they use to control it. The problems that each patient faces feels real and they connect to issues that any viewer could relate to. The casting and diversity of stories is what truly makes this show wonderful to me.On top of the treatment there is an underlining uneasiness happening in the clinic. I don't know how the story will play out but you get a clear sense that there is something more mysterious going on behind the scenes. I'm fully intrigued with this show and can't wait to see how everything plays out.

reviews.review_title: Enjoy this wonderful and unforgettable journey!!!
reviews.content: I loved it so much that I was sad that it ended. All the actors and the story are fantastic!!.Very exciting and entertaining, expect the unexpected and at the same time don't expect anything, just enjoy!Quite a journey, and a wonderful one with many things to learn, messages and unexpected curves.

The cinematography and acting is the only decent thing about the miniseries. I struggle to understand how this series has a 7.4 rating.The storyline is weak, and the whole series is stuck in the "beginning" phase. There's virtually no build up, no climax, no conclusion and it's extremely predictable. It is a fizzer.All three hours is what you'd expect the first 20 minutes of a film to cover but then it just abruptly ends with no punch.Unless there will be a follow up miniseries, it's a complete waste of time.

If you like shows about shallow and boring people, willing to put up with inane psych mantras then this is for you. Better to view it as a comedy not a drama.Pretending Australia (where it was filmed) is Big Sur should be a clue. There is not one character to be cared for, or interested in. After Big Sky I hoped Kelly would get his groove back. Nope.
Super slow. Weird artificial dialogue. Fake teeth and body doubles. None of the characters are believable. The soundtrack does not work at all.

Started with promise but goes nowhere and it's just a ridiculous premise where every episode pretty much is the same with a bit of mystery thrown in at the start. Nicole Kidman is annoying and the story is a rambling mess which ultimately goes nowhere and then would you believe it, is wrapped up with a nice warm fuzzy bow. It's supposed to have deep meaning but it's an empty vessel. I only stuck with it because I was watching it with my mum, but couldn't wait to get it over with.Great locations, cast, cinematography but empty if anything else.

Perfectly relevant. Wonderfully acted across the board. This is top tier production of story.Filled with character and drama and poignant climax each episode. There is direction and building and thorough relation with everything. No disappointment episode to episode and an overall positive outcome that closes with satisfaction and optimism.Fiction steeped with reality.The music, cinematography, acting, animation, and overall direction really sends this into the upper echelon. Brilliant.

reviews.review_title: Maybe some people are missing the point
reviews.content: This show is about people overcoming their demons by facing them head on using psychedelics. I think a lot of individuals shove the trauma that haunts them deep down inside and choose to ignore their deepest fears, which can slowly eat away at a person. After ingesting psychedelics these people are forced to face their deepest fears head on and self reflect in a way they would not be able to do outside of this altered state of consciousness. While it can be extremely unpleasant during their trip, they come out of the experience with a new perspective that can be life changing in a beneficial way. I am not someone who has taken psychedelics but can't ignore the potential benefits science is uncovering. Great acting and character development. Thank you for making this show and doing it well.

reviews.review_title: A show you must watch all the way through.
reviews.content: I'm giving this an 8 out of 10 for the sheer purpose that it makes me come back for more.4 episodes in and you still have no idea what's really going on here, no idea who these people really are, no idea what the real plot is, yet the way it unfolds I want to keep coming back to learn more.The characters are starting to develop and show their true selves more, but there's still a huge mystery about the plot and what Masha and Tranquillems true purpose is.

reviews.review_title: Great show. Likely too deep for many.
reviews.content: This show is definitely not for everyone. If you're not an empathetic person who can relate to some emotional hardship then you won't like this show because you probably won't understand it. Probably why there are some angry reviews here, people don't like being reminded that they're small minded.

reviews.review_title: Has White Lotus vibes, but it's considerably worse
reviews.content:
Nine Perfect Strangers is not a bad show, but an enticing premise and a stacked cast made me expect much morePerformances-wise
Kidman is a great actress, don't get me wrong, but I don't think she was the best one to play Masha, the main character and an innovative guru / therapy master. She is supposed to be from Russian descent, but the accent comes and goes. And what is supposed to be this larger than life intimidating figure, very quickly loses after the 1st episode.Michael Shannon on the other hand, impressed me - amazing range across the span of a few episodes.Quite a few clichés in there - there's a romance brewing throughout the show which was incredibly obvious from episode 1; as is the character arc of Masha.Also disappointing was the actual "therapy" involved in the story. The show is supposed to take place in a one-of-kind wellness centre which gets amazing results through unorthodox methods. In what is at worse a mild spoiler, I was disappointed to find out this "therapy" consists only of drugs...All in all I think this show had the budget and talent to be much better; but fails to deliver on a promising trailer and plot (I can imagine the book it is based on must be great source material).And pales in comparison to how refreshing White Lotus was!

reviews.review_title: A waste of time, even in lockdown
reviews.content: Do something else with your time, anything to avoid watching this.Stare at a wall if you have to.

reviews.review_title: I felt good after watching this
reviews.content: Oh I thought this was so great. Felt like I could breathe better after watching it. Nicole Kidman does it again, she is in everything! Love what she does. Melissa McCarthy has never been better. All the acting and characters were great 👌, it was funny and moving and took me on a journey. Highly recommend!
I was really looking forward to this. Sadly, it just plods along and then fizzles out with a ludicrous happy ever after ending.

I made it through all 8 episodes but had to fast-forward through all of them. I wanted to get to the end to see how it ended and I'm sorry that I did. I can't tell you how many times I cried out, "Ohhhh, just shut up with your whining already. Just please shut up". It was dozens of times.After the first episode, I was pretty stoked. Great actors, an intriguing plot, and beautiful scenery. That fell apart and I quickly came to dislike all of these characters and the actors who played them. The story is meaningless and it goes nowhere.

reviews.review_title: You've got this strange effect on me..
reviews.content: And I like it. This series was excellent. Not being the biggest fan of Nicole Kidman, I wasn't sure what to expect. To say I was pleasantly surprised would be pretty accurate. She gave a truly layered and complex performance to an equally complex storyline. Really breathed life into a riveting topic, especially with such a dynamic cast of great actors. Their performances were so raw at times, particularly those of Michael Shannon and Melissa McCarthy.Suspenseful, soul searching and surprisingly intriguing. It's a journey. That's for sure, and a trippy one at that. Never really quite knew what to expect and that's the best part! Definitely worth watching. Great premise and an even better cast. Highly recommend!

I just finished watching all 8 episodes and kudos to all the people that worked on this show. It is successful and although a little rough at times, they pulled it off. The finale was even a tear jerker for me. Psychedelics can be used successfully. It was interesting to watch the people change...

reviews.review_title: The Menu: Detox (or The count is on)
reviews.content: No pun intended - and I finally came around watching this. What a great cast this has - this will probably be the first thing you notice. And while I would not call myself a fan of Ms. Kidman, her performance here should convince anyone of her acting abilities to say the least. The show begins by introducing us to all the characters ... and what a fine introduction we get.While the show tells us about nine strangers it does not seem to include the therapist people ... and also "only" has 8 episodes! More than enough of course and for some even more than necessary. I obviously am not including myself to the latter group.There are quite a few surprises along the way and we know that things are not always exactly what they seem ... or that there is more to them that we may know. There are secrets and there are things that people bottle up ... I had no idea where the movie would take me - and hopefully you have not read too much about this either.The fun is discovering things with and along the characters. Unorthodox methods included ... with or without results you ask? That is for us to find out ... I may have rated it a bit too high for some - but I really liked it! It combined characters and it went places that were surprising ... and for that I really embraced what it did. Even if some people got the short stick (no pun intended) ... there are of course things that some might find hard to swallow or believe, but yes even people that we perceive as super beautiful do not feel that way themselves ... no matter how crazy that may seem to us ... and crazy is something that the show does really well ... and with that pun I'll leave you to it ... work on that.

reviews.review_title: Brilliantly executed from start to finish!!
reviews.content: I had read the book, which I really enjoyed, but the series is outstanding!! Such an usual cast, yet every actor perfect for their part (Melissa McCarthy is truly awesome in this!!). The acting, directing and production are all first class, Nicole Kidman is mesmerising in the lead role, and even though I'm not keen on the fake 'Russian accent,' I think it kind of added to her cult-guru-like persona at the beginning, so you can't tell for a while if she's real or fake in the show.I had to BINGE WATCH this as it was SO good, plus there are some VERY deep messages here about personal trauma and loss, so take care. But I think it's beautifully and sensitively done, esp if you love watching the dynamics between people and characters. A really GREAT watch, more like it please!!!!

This has got to be the slowest moving show/series/movie I have ever witnessed. I thought at the very end of the 1st episode something interesting was about to happen. Nope. I was wrong. She just stood in the center of the circle. I realize that this show is adapted from the book. I'm going to assume those who have rated this show so highly are fans of the book. This is not Big Little Lies. This is straight up boring. Not even Melissa McCarthy can save this one.

With the same book author (Moriarty) and producer (David E Kelly) as Big Little Lies, it definitely has a similar feel. I've seen most of what I think of as shows capitalizing on the Big Little Lies lightening-in-a-bottle success (The Undoing, Big Sky, Little Fires Everywhere, even Sharp Objects to some extent) and most of them sadly don't quite hit the mark. This is the best offering of the bunch so far, while having a unique enough story to be engaging. I enjoyed the first episodes very much, and am glad they dropped more than one!Positives so far:
*Location and intrigue (I am avoiding book spoilers; I don't know where the story is going)
*Good Pacing
*Excellent Music and Cinematography
*Every character is very interesting and I want to know more. On the surface they seem like caricatures of the kind of people to attend an expensive retreat but I'm not mad about it.*Casting is nearly perfectMy favorite actors/characters so far: The Good Place's Manny Jacinta, Bobby Cavale, Mellissa McCarthy, Tiffany Boone (young Mia from Little Fires Everywhere), and Samara Weaving.Negatives so far: (not much!)
*Sadly, Nicole Kidman is the biggest negative here! I wish first and foremost they would have skipped the Russian part of her character as her fake accent is terribly inconsistent and distracting. Plus since it is a similar show to Big Little Lies, I only see Celeste all the time. Loved her as season one Celeste (though overall season two was a big letdown). She annoyed me in The Undoing, so maybe I'm just tired from the over-saturation of Nicole Kidman in these kinds of stories?*The only other negative at this time is some of the characters are a bit flat right now; but I do think that will change as the show progresses and they each get their moment. Need more from Luke Evans, Michael Shannon and his teen daughter, Samara Weaving's husband guy, and Regina King before making final verdicts on them.Overall, a great start! Probably an 8-9 rating at this point; I will update my rating after the show concludes. I recommend giving it a shot!

I just finished episode 5...........and I'm still wondering when it's all going to kick off. Nothing much else has happened. A few flashbacks. A few visions. A few odd conversations between characters.I was really looking forward to this but you can tell there is a problem when your partner would rather listen to Spotify and I'm concentrating more on my candy crush..............because...........after 5 hours.............
NOTHING IS HAPPENING!!!Watch it..........if you really want to.

reviews.review_title: Pretty okay, but that last episode? Booooo
reviews.content: The last episode ruined the show.Lazy deus ex machina.
Hooked immediately! Superb cast, intriguing script and storyline.

Honestly, I really enjoyed this show! I thought all the actors and actresses were amazing. It was interesting seeing Melisa McCarthy do such a serious role but I think she nailed, but I'm so used to seeing her all cheerful and funny so it took some getting used to lol, but I really enjoyed her nonetheless. I never read the book so I don't know how close it is to the novel. Apparently people didn't like Nicole Kidman's character? Not sure why, I thought she was one of the most interesting and mysterious characters in the show. There were moments that I was able to call ahead before it was actually revealed. The biggest one was how she was drugging everyone. I called it with-in the first episode and then the third or fourth episode she was forced to admit to it. So there were obviously predictable moments in the show, but I still really enjoyed the show. It's different from a lot of stuff out there. I think I liked it so much because I really loved the casting and their characters. It was deep and emotional.

reviews.review_title: Still waiting for something to happen...
reviews.content: I've watched the only three first episodes I've been allowed to watch, but I'm not sure I will continue. It reminds me of the Talking Head's song "Heaven" ("is a place where nothing ever happens").Each episode ends with the feeling that the next one will be the one with any sort of revelation. Talking about good acting, or cinematography, or scenery, doesn't really matters much. These people came to this place to "change their lives"... well, I never thought one could do that with the power of sheer silliness or boredom. And, as much as it has tried, the boredom bit hasn't worked for me.
Just no interest to keep me watching. I tried to find something to keep me watching but I ended up turning it off. Wasted 3 hours of my life...

reviews.review_title: solid 8 for the intrigue, the acting and the cast...
reviews.content: Right off the bat I will say that while many have trashed Kidman for her Russian accent, I respectfully call bs. I see it as a Russian who has been in America for awhile and now has an softened, Americanized Russian accent. It happens to some folks who come here from other countries after they have been here awhile. It happens the other way around too. Americans in other countries start to pick up hints of their accent and blend it with their own. It will only be a distraction if you let it be and if you still choose to let the accent distract you, you will miss out on some great acting.Moving on... Kidman is wonderful in this role. She is supposed to be mysterious and intriguing and she is. Her expressions are perfect and that is one of the hallmarks of a truly mysterious person, they express more than they speak.All the other actors are top notch too and just as mysterious. I'm loving watching their layers fall away, exposing them for who they really are and why they are at the retreat in the first place.This is well worth the watch and I am eagerly awaiting the next five episodes.

reviews.review_title: Wildly uneven actorinh wildly uneven ride
reviews.content: The very last 2 minutes were better than the entire 8 episodes. That end scene didn't match the rest of this series which was mediocre at best.I want to see the series that felt like the end scenes.It had promise: scenery was gorgeous, music was good, Canavale and McCarthy adorable.What ruined it for me? Carmel was so incredibly irritating (what the hell was the cloudy blue eye all about?) and the young married couple. Oh boy. Their acting was amongst the worst I have ever seen in my life. He honestly looked as if he was made of wood.The plot meandered and the whole premise felt so forced after the first couple episodes. Microdosing sounds like an interesting subject, but this just had nowhere to go after it was rather clumsily revealed.Its the kind of series you can leave and mop the kitchen floor come back and absolutely nothing missed.I thought the Dad overacted ( the crying towards the end - just bad). Kidman actually did a decent job with what she was given. The character was pretty one dimensional so there was only so much she could do.It isn't total crap, but it certainly ain't good.

reviews.review_title: Not a thriller and barely a mystery.
reviews.content: I don't know but Nicole is starting to look like a mannequin - similar to the Thirteenth Floor episode of the Twilight Zone. Stop with the Botox. If you can't do Russian simply change the country of origin. It had nothing to do with the story anyway. It was a throwaway. I found it boring and depressing with a lot of loose ends. I heard they green lit a season 2. I did really enjoy Big Little Lies but this can't compare even given a blockbuster cast. I always enjoy watching Bobby C.
Omg, I don't know where I start, perfect story, perfect casting, everybody so real and 5 star acting. I love Nicole Kidman, for me she is always great, also in this series she looks nice.Good job!

reviews.review_title: Enjoyable for fans of great acting
reviews.content: I liked the story well enough. I didn't read the book but I saw some of the major developments coming after a couple episodes. The acting is good all around, especially Bobby Cannavale, Michael Shannon and Regina Hall as they really sink their teeth into these roles. Nicole Kidman goes in and out of one of the worst Russian accents I've ever heard and sports a terrible wig but she is good in her role despite these pitfalls. The direction is fine and cinematography is beautiful.

Terrible script, very awkward sequences. The whole thing was cringe worthy. I like watching cringe on occassion but I thought this was supposed to have a plot..and actually be half-decent so at this point I'm just watching to laugh at how horrible it is. And yes Kidman's accent is hilarious, it's so bad.

I have to say, that at first everything felt a bit weird. But as the story and the characters develop I saw myself drawn into each of their stories.Without spoiling anything-- I imagine that the bad reviews are due to the explicit usage of some non conventional substances and the jab this show throws at modern day medicine and doctors.Nine Perfect Strangers shows us what it's like to let down your guard, get to know something or someone new, finding the root to whatever might sit wrong with your mind and your heart, and how to find an innovative way to get past with what's wrong.It's way more complex than this story, but as a person who've gotten past anxiety and trauma with a similar treatment-- I encourage Amazon on shining light on the subject.I like how we get Good representation on different typer of personalities and how they learn to be compassionate towards eachother in this very isolated setting.Melissa McCarthy is the leading lady in this and everyone else is supporting her beautifully.
Bloody hell, Nicole Kidman's Russian accent is dreadful. Five episodes in, and it's a complete bore fest. All the characters are awful to.

I really tried to give this show a chance if nothing else because of the stellar cast of Hollywood A listers. I only lasted 3 episodes so my comments are only based on less than half the story.I couldn't relate to any of the characters although I didn't find any of them objectionable apart from Nicole Kidman who wafts around the place being all ethereal and saying "Nameste", which is just annoying. Melissa McCarthy plays a good part, maybe she should ditch the "comedy" roles as she is funny as a children's cancer ward.The plot, such as it exists, is paper thin. I hoped for some hint that things were not as they seem, that the group were at the health resort for some other reason than their health, that something sinister lay beneath. Sadly after 3 episodes nothing of the sort happens. The woman running the show, Nicole Kidman, gets some threatening text messages but these aren't made much of. The rest is just people whining, sorry, talking through their first world "issues" like how difficult it is to adjust to winning the lottery or the trails of being an Instagram Thot.I've no doubt that some will find it all fascinating, I suspect mostly women. On the plus side the locations look spectacular and are beautifully photographed and the acting is solid.

Usually with a series the first episode is great and then it goes downhill from there .. but with 9 Perfect Strangers it has got stronger after the third episode and I cannot wait for episode 4 . I have to say Melissa McCarthy is fantastic in this and really is the star of the show . I'm completely enthralled in this show.

reviews.review_title: I am liking it so far @ep3
reviews.content: I've watched the first three episodes and I am liking it so far.It's funny, ironic and dark: a mix that works for me.I think acting is good, and the Cannavale-McCharty duo works very well (I am inclined to think they were also having lots of fun on set having given I spotted her laughing in the grape-by-the-pool-killer-scene).I am also appreciating a lot Michael Shannon's interpretation: he does a great job in that role, which is not easy at allI haven't read the book, though I am looking forward to next episodes release.A solid 7 by now: entertaining, well acted, interesting plot.

reviews.review_title: Promises a lot but goes nowhere
reviews.content: Intriguing start. A list actors. Where's the twist? When it comes it's underwhelming. LSD?? Bit pretentious really and probably better as a book.

I think the acting is great. And the environment beautiful. At times I found the show intriguing, especially in the beginning, but then the anticipation for something to happen got tiring because it never really did. Well, maybe the season finale will make up for it.I read a review regarding the characters being stereotypes. I didn't notice it myself but yes, that reviewer isn't wrong.And hehe I don't think the author(/director?) has ever munched on magic mushrooms.

I dived into this one without knowledge beforehand. It was slow burning in the beginning. You definitely need to keep watching (don't just watch a few episodes). I thought each actor had a great performance. You could understand what each of the characters were going through. I found myself really rooting for them despite the craziness. Those saying the Russian accent was bad, should watch Inventing Anna = ) Nicole's was definitely not that bad! Overall a good watch.

My wife and I enjoyed the series for the most part. There are several outstanding scenes, especially when Michael Shannon is on screen. The self help micro-dosing concept is interesting, the Nicole stalker not so much... we also were horrified to discover that Nicole seems to have gotten a boob job and her face never moves, she's like a robot in almost every scene and that in and of itself was super distracting from the overall concept.
Marconi family acting rocks. So endearing.Melissa McCarthy more in love with her everyday here she displays her grandeur.Perhaps last episode is the best.

reviews.review_title: If you can't develop after 4 episodes. What's the point?
reviews.content: Mostly Great cast but the story line seriously meanders.It develops but not into anything truly meaningful or lasting = boring and very few almost no laughs.

reviews.review_title: Emotionally hard to watch but uplifting
reviews.content: As literal as it is, nine strangers are facing their own pain and darkness together in a healing resort. A quite diverse ensemble, and I think everyone is equally annoying right from the start. The therapy sessions led by ex-Russian mafia Masha (Nicole Kidman) and her assistants, Yao (Manny Jacinto - yum) and her girl Delilah (Tiffany Boone).There are several back story to the characters' arc which happen to tangle with each other. But I think the weakest arc is the love triangle of Masha-Yao-Delilah.There are also MANY triggering scenes, they even put a trigger warning in one episode. The characters often display verbal and physical abuse to self or even to others. But I think one of the therapy session, the "fire therapy" to simulate near death experience and stimulate vulnerability was a spot on when the conflict escalate.I like how all the characters develop, and even find love from each other. Seeing the positive energy coming from all the broken people who lift each other up is bittersweet and heartwarming. Watching this series is a bit hard but it help me personally to cope with my own trauma.
To the few negative critics with ADHD here, complaining about "slow" and "boring" maybe you'd be better off sticking to the Avengers comic book movies.

Well that was 6 hours and 28 minutes I'll never get back.If you're up to episode 2 or 3 and you're reading this review, expecting the show will "get better eventually", or for some huge surprise reveal at the end that makes the long wait worth it, then save yourself the time, because there is none. It is talking, followed by more talking, between characters you really care nothing about, that goes absolutely nowhere. I actually found myself disliking every single character more and more with each episode and was hoping it would end with them all drinking poisoned kool-aid like some whacked out cult.Honestly, I can't imagine how empty someone's life is that they could possibly be so entertained listening to ficticious people talk about theirs. You may as well just eaves drop strangers on a bus or train and call it a "show".So here's a spoiler alert - this series is terrible.
Incredible show, very unique. This show will keep you guessing the whole time. In my top ten watchlists.

The book was garbage. After Big Little Lies I had hopes. But no. But as is usually not the case, this series exceeds the book. It's a steaming pile of garbage. It's just a bunch of unlikeable in every way cretins being 'guided' by an Aussie with a pathetic school-yard Russian accent that randomly morphs into American and French and I think I detected a little occasional Chinese in there too. She's basically Gru without the charm and sex appeal. Cruise Control will be obsessively analysing this 'work' (and I use the word loosely) as I'm sure he does with all her stuff, and thinking "At last! Something sooo much more cringe-worthy than jumping on Oprah's sofa." Nice to see McCarthy, who should have been fired after S1E1 of The Gilmore Girls, just being annoying and forgettable as opposed to her usual obnoxious gutter-mouthed slob routine. You just sit there hoping and preying they will all be killed off sequentially in extremely painful circumstances. But no. We need a new law passed - anyone who gave this stoolstack more than a star or two should be taken off the electoral roll right now.
Not much happens. Lost interest after 5 episodes. It might have worked better as a movie.

Fortunately I've never come across such an abusive therapist as Masha in my life.Considering that there was a scope for fantastic imageries conjured by psychedelics, it turned out to be visually flat show. Even actors appeared bored (especially ones playing Tony, Ben and Zoe).The most irritating thing in Marconi family was that their surviving child had to anchor the visions in their group psychedelic trip - it felt jarring that kid was taking caring of parents or taking responsibility of their experience, that too in a supposedly therapeutic atmosphere.With so many characters from widely different backgrounds, the show could have been dynamic but it turned out to be boring. It felt as if at times actors were lost wondering what they were doing.

I am a huge Liane Moriarty fan (What Alice Forgot, Big Little Lies, The Husband's Secret) and am always weary when a book is made into a TV show or movie. (To say that is an understatement; My feelings for book-to-screen is VERY well-documented with MULTIPLE hours of ranting).Well, I guess I'll never question Hulu again! First of all, you have Melissa McCarthy. I have loved her since she was Sooki on Gilmore Girls 21 years ago (holy moly it really has been that long since GG aired). I've followed her career closely over the last two decades and have watched most of her performances. Here, they let Melissa be Melissa. She's well-composed, honest, and (no surprise) hilarious, delivering every line effortlessly and with humour. Right in the first episode, we get dramatic moments with her that are absolutely heart-wrenching and already showing the actress' incredible range. I was blown away.Then we got Nicole Kidman. Holy moly. If ever there was the perfect casting for a role, certainly this was it. Like in the book, the woman who runs the retreat is beautiful, mysterious, and absolutely enchanting. Kidman plays the role so well I'm breathless every time she's on screen.I see in some reviews people complain about the pacing. If you've ever read a Liane Moriarty book, you'll know that she does the "slow burn" very well. Her writing is in the complexity of her character and their relationships with one another. When watching the show, you should be asking yourself, "What are they hiding?" Because in a Moriarty book, no one is as they seem.I hope people enjoy this interpretation of Nine Perfect Strangers. As a reader and a great enjoyer of entertainment, I certain am excited to watch this all the way through. It truly is my new obsession.

reviews.review_title: Would be perfect except for Kidman
reviews.content: Nicole Kidman looks so creepy and inhuman here it distracts from the story. She's supposed to be a beautiful Russian and she is neither. She looks alien. Otherwise it's a great show and I was instantly drawn in.

I kept waiting for something to happen. It felt like after the 1st few episodes it was just more of the same. I got really bored towards the end. The most interesting episode was the last one, but it really wasn't worth the wait. The ending was sickly sweet and pretty weak in my opinion. On top of that you to endure Nicole kidmans laughable Russian accent as she pouted her way through the story. Overall pretty forgettable stuff.

reviews.review_title: How can anyone think Nicole Kidman is bad in this?!
reviews.content: My question is twofold: how can you think she is bad in this, when she is so great in this, and also- how can you think her character is supposed to be bad, when she is so sweet?!I have read so many reviews here that say "Nicole Kidman can't play a bad person!" Well, she's not! Marsha is a good person, in case you haven't noticed how kind she's been to all the guests (and no, I don't think she's faking it). I love Nicole's character in this- it has made me develop quite a crush on her. She's so nurturing and sweet, as well as beautiful as Marsha! Why so many complain about her accent and all, I can't understand- I love it!!As for the show itself, it is stunning; superb acting, visuals, dialogue, etc. It really keeps me interested, and it's a real treat for the eyes and ears. I was hooked from the very first time I heard the fabulous theme-song, and it's now my new favorite show! I love everything about this show. It's thrilling, mysterious, beautiful, and touching all at once. Highly recommended!

reviews.review_title: Don't know you should or shouldn't have read the book
reviews.content: I don't know if you should or shouldn't have read the book to watch the TV show. If you haven't, after 3 episodes you still have no clue what's going on and you don't catch on the eery feeling the book have you. If you have read it, you see that there is not much left of the story. The smoothies, fastening and not talking were really big aspects of at least the first half of the book. In the TV show they don't do the silence or fastening and you only notice the smoothies bc they were a big thing in the book. Also after 3 episodes they already reveal the big twist, which only happens in the book at like 90% of the story.. I get that they spiced the TV show up a bit for TV purposes, but why make a TV show based on a book of you're gonna ignore 75% of the story? I'm curious to see what they do in the remaining episodes, but so far I don't have much hope.

reviews.review_title: Episode 1 was great then nothing. Nothing really happens at all here.
reviews.content: Disappointing ! The show doesn't offer a compelling statement on wellness or anything else. It barely scratches the surface.The cast is great. Strong performances across the board.I had great expectations, Episode 1 was brilliant, but then EP 2, EP3 felt like an eternity...slow, no development. It makes you wondering what is the topic of this show ? It doesn't seem to go somewhere; mystical ? Psychological ? What's the meaning of this ?
We enjoyed it, but for the life of me, I can explain why. The scenery was beautiful. The acting was good. But the ending ruined it for me.

Very gripping , well acted series . My wife and me love it from the get go.Please dont be stuck with kidman's russian accent, she played a russian mail order bride 20 yrs ago in BIRTHDAY GIRL... give it a fair shot and you'll enjoy this show...

reviews.review_title: Great cast, curious story, cheap ending
reviews.content: What's not to like about some sharp dramatic talent in a dream ensemble cast series, gorgeous production values and soundtrack. Subject matter is confrontational therapy retreat focusing on mans' search for meaning in a hyper-materialistic world, in a posh bespoke eco-retreat setting for mostly wealthy Americans. It almost works as a dark satire of wellness culture the way To Die For satirized middle class ruthless ambition and obsession with fame. Sadly it morphs in the end into a facile fantasy and marketing presentation to romanticize and legitimize psychedelics as miracle therapeutics for emotional pain, coming soon in our dystopic future. Because in the end, everyone successfully integrates their pain, the girl gets the guy, and the investigators are left with nothing to prosecution, despite abuse and neglect of the first order.

Giving up at episode 4. Normally love Nicole Kidman but acting is unbelievable. Melissa McCarthy is acting in a Melissa McCarthy movie. It doesn't move along. No intrigue. Don't care about any of the characters. A lot of the writing feels contrived and unrealistic. Too many close up shots of Nicole Kidman trying to look crazy.

reviews.review_title: One of the best psychological thrillers I've seen
reviews.content: The backstories, the tension, the pace, the acting, the scenery, all top notch!It's a light watch and funny, yet emotional, witty, and keeps you wondering and at the edge of your seat all the time.And Nicole kidman, how old is this woman? Looking hot as ever!Thoroughly enjoying it!

reviews.review_title: Not even Melissa McCarthy could save this awful series
reviews.content: It's somewhat intriguing at first. But the first (and every time) you hear that horrible "Russian" accent from Nicole Kidman, it comes off as an amateur effort by screenwriters who could not come up with a great story on their own (since this is based on a book). I have not read the book and after watching this stinker, I won't read the book. Hard to believe so many talented actors joined this cast, given this truly awful script.

reviews.review_title: Everything is OFF about this show!
reviews.content: Everything about this show is OFF! Right from the camera angle to that of most of the cast! There have been movies and tv shows adapted from bestselling novels, but no one went that far off the track as this show did.The actors do not do justice to the characters; sometimes they come too strong or very confused. There is no old house that took so many pages of the book, or the silence that took quite many chapters, or the gate that refused to open.There is a mystery to an extent, but there is no arc to it. There was no prime point in the series (until episode 5) where you would like to revisit and watch it. There are funny moments and light tones and that's about it. It's no salvation. The married couple looks married and nothing in their marriage is falling apart. Luke can conveniently hide stuff despite being watched under surveillance. You will not get the smiley tattoo or the bonding of Frances and Tony.The direction is horrid. It is only good as a college movie. Oh! And there was a GOAT! No metaphor, no symbolism, nothing. It was just a Goat!Characters are unwinding in a haste; Lacking to score the connection of empathy with the audience. The moment you decide to like a character or even feel sorry for it, it will transform into something it wasn't - blaming it on a smoothie!Leaving aside the book, even considering the multi-talented actors and giving the benefit to this show as an independent (of the book) project, it is still BAD.

... but I am giving it a straight 10 because of:* the absolute originality of the script (book)
* the ingenious cast (unprecedented in a TV show, this is such a perfect ensemble that the acting alone makes it worth watching)
* fantastic dialogues throughout all 8 episodes (so well written!)
* characters and character development
* surprise factor (it's already really good during the first episodes though you have no clue at the beginning where this will all be going...)
* those really nice and subversive/satirical punches against the whole wellness industry and all that constant striving to perfect ourselves
* satisfying ending.

reviews.review_title: Michael Shannon. That's all. That's the review....
reviews.content: "Brilliant" is too mundane a word to describe Michael Shannon's performance. "Transcendent" is overused to the point of blandness. To quote his character, "I go back to madness." Mad, transcendent brilliance seems like a good place to start describing what he achieves here. Melissa McCarthy's performance yet again confirms her spot at the top of my "fantasy best friend list" and I may be willing to let Bobby Cannavale crash the party because his performance was so darn disarming that every scene he was in was an unexpected emotional risk worth taking. Luke Evans succeeds to sneak up on you as the confidant you didn't know you needed and Carmel? Let's just say I feel a tiny bit of her pain.I'm....sorry - I just did a whiskey spit-take because "Fabio" Cannavale...you'll know when you see it.But Jesus - Michael Shannon. This is gonna be a moment for him. This is gonna be a thing.

Personally, i'm loving this series. Michael Shannon and Melissa McCarthy give standout performances, and the inherent weirdness of wellness retreats makes for a great backdrop of a mystery-comedy thriller.

I was highly anticipating this series but sadly Nicole Kidmans performance ruined each and every episode
Bobby Carnevale and Melissa McCartney were the only two who kept me watching.It was all over the place with no direction at all
3/10 was a stretch.

I began watching this unsure of what I thought about it, finger resting on the remote. However each episode had me impatiently anticipating the next and finally longing for a second season fingers crossed! A fresh and fun little gem.
It took 8 episodes to get to the meaning of the story, and it's all based off a 90's song. Could have done in 6 episodes.
Not sure how I have missed it in the past, but holy cow Michael Shannon is a fantastic actor. I enjoyed the entire ensemble and the story, but Michael Shannon's performance was just perfection.

I read the Liane Moriaty book a while ago and thought it was rubbish.Gave the series 2 episodes just in case it turned into something glorious like Big Little Lies ( didn't read that book) ... but had to give it up because it didn't.Just finished another of her books called The Husbands Secret and wow there's a book that could be a film.

reviews.review_title: There are better mini series to watch.
reviews.content: Could have given this a 5 or 5.5, but was disappointed as it went on. Not the best mini series out there.Good premise, but the situation with the family and their dead son/brother was unfitting and a little overdone in terms of being sappy. Most of the series was like a naval gazing version of survivor at times, and lacked any real humor to counteract that. A few characters were misplaced, and, above all, Nicole Kidman and her character was contrived. She was weird and creepy without actually being entertaining, or interesting (other than maybe her past).Now, the good part were the performances by Luke Evans, and, especially, Melissa McCarthy. This was one of her better roles and character and she delivered with conviction and caliber on that category.

reviews.review_title: Final review: If you'll watch it, be warned
reviews.content: I waited to watch all 8 episodes before writing this review. I don't agree with those reviews based on 1 or little more episodes that say the pace is too slow. It is slow but at the same time engaging, at least for me since I am a psychotherapist.I do agree with the reviews on Nicole: she is a beautiful woman but has to urgently stop freezing her face. It is really distracting to look at and it does not serve her nor her work, which is such a loss.I was surprised by her failed Russian accent. She has been one of my favorite actors and I didn't believe a review that stated this fact until I heard it myself. It is really weak, not expected at all.The show has promise during all episodes. I was really interested in knowing how it would end and I can say that I was not expecting what I saw.As a therapist I have to say: Masha was a broken person from the start and people who are that much broken can not heal others. She mixes her own experiences with those around her, she is deeply manipulative. Both really off tools to be able to help anyone. Manipulate? Yes.Then there are the drugs. Please be aware. Hallucinogenics can't make you heal, on the contrary.

You know maybe we just need to let our hair down and imagine the other side. Others stories, others feelings, others journeys.Just a great, feel good series. PSYCHADELIC and bonkers in places but keeps the intrigue.

I had read the book and was interested to see how this would compare.Sadly it is not authentic. Not the actors fault - except perhaps Kidman who was involved in its fruition.How Marsha transitioned was not true to the book and personally I feel it matters. There is some good acting in this show but sadly is not Kidman. I can only imagine that Liane Moriarty surely is disappointed - I would be.
I expected better from Moriarty. The story itself was bad, in addition the actors did a tremendously horrendous job and made it all even worse. It is a shame.

reviews.review_title: I'm not sure when it gets good
reviews.content: I have watched all 4 episodes to date and yet to find the story very compelling, in fact I'd say that it's a borefest.....

reviews.review_title: What started out interesting became redundant and boring
reviews.content: Interesting premise with some (not all) good acting but episode after episode became a boring repeat of previous episodes. The one character I could not stand was Regina Hall as Carmel. Didn't like her at all as she over acted in virtually every episode. I was hoping she'd do us all a favor and jump off a cliff. In addition Nicole Kidman with that Russian accent was poorly executed. Look, I will give her credit for trying but it didn't work for me. This should have been a 2 hour movie and not a 10 episode bore fest. And when you finally get to the end ... good Lord was it stupid. The one couple end up taking over camp. Don't ask how. Just accept it. Ummm ... no!

I switched off after half an hour.I didn't care for the characters and had no yearning to watch the drivel.Nicole Kidman has made some great movies in the past and should steer away from nonsense like this.
I watched and watched hoped something would finally happen. BUT NOTHiNG!!! Awful and boring. Dont watch this crap!

Leave Nicole Kidman alone. She is great in this. Inspiring on a personal level. The rest of the cast are a mixed bag. Michael Shannon is one of those can do anything. The Vine guy doesn't have much to do. Melissa McCarthy - dependable but the same as always. Regina Hall - just weird. Luke Evans- uncomfortable and creepy. But Nicole. ....Nicole is great. I feel this could have been much shorter and it almost lost me at times but I am very curious to see the final episode. It's a very strange brew of anxiety snd hope or something.

reviews.review_title: This show is the worst, it keeps pretending like there is a reason for what is happening but there isn't
reviews.content: Truly awful show, pointless, waste of time.Acting was good and scenery was beautiful.The story and writing were terrible. Nothing made sense, and the ending which seemed like it would be this big climax was just weird and nothing actually happened.The A list cast made me think there might be something to the show, but I can promise you there is not. This might be the worst show ever created.

reviews.review_title: Sorry Nicole, love you but Britt Marling you ain't.
reviews.content: Couldn't help but think this was a feeble attempt to capture some of the mystique of The OA. My disbelief was not suspended. Only two episodes in and not sure I'll keep going when the I it character find even remotely interesting is the poor man's Margot Robbie trying to be Annie Murphy from Schitt's Creek.

Didn't like it, i was trying to understand the whole thing and when I actually understand whats going on suddenly the episode finishes and there's new things to understand the next episode.Could've been A LOT better with this staff, im a bit disappointed but not surprised.

David E. Kelley, et. Al. Has ruined a phenomenal novel by Liane Moriarity. The book was a fantastic read that did not need major changes. Before I say anything further, the acting from the ensemble cast is Emmy caliber quality. Bobby Cannavale, Melissa McCarthy, Luke Evans, Jason Castro, Michael Shannon and the rest deliver award quality performances. HOWEVER, After the first few episodes the show bears little resemblance to the wonderful story from the book. Little tweaks and changes were not made but a sea change of plot points were ripped out and ruined. I am very disappointed with the direction of CARMEL and Masha as written (actors are amazing) because it unnecessary. Carmel is NOT a psychopath. Lost in Hulu version is the main Transformative experience from the book for the entire group. Instead the writers work in an against character rabbit trail for the Marconis. Wish I could check out early from Tranquilum house but I'll suffer through the finale.

Excellent series, and a storyline intriguing. The acting is exceptional. Love the cast, perfect. Love that we can laugh too, the dynamics between the characters are truly entertaining. Looking forward to more. So curious !
One of the worst and most ridiculous TV series I have ever seen. Nothing new, not a single new or interesting idea. Apart from the cast, which is outstanding, especially young Grace van Patton.

reviews.review_title: Great cast, nothing else to recommend it
reviews.content: Pedigree doesn't ensure watchable tv. Characters were broad, unengaging and unlikeable. Nicole plays a pastiche of a Russian guru, unmovable in every way. Couldn't imagine sitting through another episode. Awful.
Interesting characters, somewhat predictable at times. A central storyline that Im sure many of us would try if given the opportunity. Definately worth a watch.

reviews.review_title: I love you Nicole but no!
reviews.content: Boring. Mama and I waiting for the whole series to come out so we can just binge it. For such an impeccable cast, we're 4 episodes in and have gone nowhere.

reviews.review_title: I stuck it out to the finish
reviews.content: I really could not make much sense of this. Neither do I suspect the cast or characters did. I only hope the writers did. The underlying idea was implausible to say the least and even allowing for this made no sense.I watched this following Big Little Lies and with a good cast hoped this would be of the same standard. How disappointing.The final shot of the characters at the end looking relieved summed it all up. It looked as though they were about to burst into song.The best part was the choice of songs to accompany the action and I looked in vain for any listing.

The first 4 episodes are great cliff hanging and enjoyable.The last 4 is a drug filled fest with the last 20min of the show, giving the happy ending you'd expect.I did not enjoy the back half of this show at all.

reviews.review_title: Had me hooked ...but then the final episode happened and ruined the whole experience.
reviews.content: The characters are interesting and it feels like a mystery is unraveling. Yet nothing really does. There's nothing sinister, even regarding things that should be, like heavily drugging people without their consent or holding them hostage, among much more.Instead of some reveal, it turns out everyone's happy and good people. This feels akin to pro-cult propaganda or something with how it ends up.The acting is great, but the story really isn't. It's sad that many ideas for good endings are staring us all in the face, but at the end I regretted watching something I expected to be more of a mystery or thriller that turned out to be whatever this is. Even traumatic or illegal acts are brushed under the rug and suddenly people who were very much not ok with it are? It felt so rushed and abrupt.If there's a message here, I can't see it. Maybe "seize the day" but anything beyond that simple thought is just not there. Most of the messages you could glean from this are incredibly unhealthy.The ending is so dissatisfying.

After 3 episodes, I had to force myself not to turn it off. Gonna give it one more shot. If the fourth episode is still this boring, that's it for me. Surely, there's got to be some point to all of this, then again, maybe not, we'll see.

Nicole was great, but what a ridiculous ending! No real closer. I was ep5 and thing should i continue? I should have not no climax nothing! Aside from my Aussie mate Nicole playing stone cold sociopath she is is! David e Kelly scripts have a beginning and an end! Such a shame.3 stars and 3 hours out of my life!

The book was SO good: thrilling, witty, I try, and thought-provoking. This is nothing like the book. Character names and some backstory info is the same, plus some minor plot points. But otherwise, it is nothing like the book. I am disappointed. It was still interesting but just not as good.

What just happened here?A cast of famous actors plus a director and writer with proven credits gather at a boutique resort in the Australian hinterland during a global pandemic to film Nine Perfect Strangers, pretending its California. That's the first deception.The second is that this mini- series looks enticing and promising from the packaging but turns out to be an overblown disappointment once you've got the wrapper off and started streaming. You're left feeling indulged but unsatisfied.So what goes wrong?For a start the plot is so unfocused and meandering that from episode 2 onwards you keep turning to your partner and asking " Where is this going??" Not a good sign. Then there's the script; so heavy and surreal in places that you feel like you're taking the magic mushrooms on offer to the guests. Most of the characters are wooden and unbelievable; you can't even be bothered not to like them. There are a few good moments; Melissa McCarthy as the washed up writer and Michael Shannon as the grief stricken dorky Dad have some strong scenes, but nowhere near enough to sustain you through 8 tedious episodes. Even Nicole Kidman, worth watching if only to see again her versatility, looks as if she has her tongue firmly in her cheek as she works with the accent of the Russian guru.I suspect they all had a great time filming this during 2020 but you're left feeling it was at our expense.
